title: What is Melting and Boiling points? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are four terms here, and they are paired off. Boiling Point: The temperature at which a substance turns from a liquid into a gas.Condensation Point: The temperature at which a substance turns from a gas into a liquid. Same as Boiling Point, usually.Melting Point: The temperature at which a substance turns from a solid into a liquid.Freezing Point: The temperature at which a substance turns from a liquid into a solid. Same as Melting Point, usually.

The melting point (or, rarely, liquefaction point) of a solid is the temperature at which it changes state from solid to liquid at atmospheric pressure.example for steel it is 1427 degree centigradeBOILLING POINT:-the temperature at which a liquid boils and turns to vapour.example for water it is 100degree centigrade
